maml:description.maml:para: Creates an API.
The New-AzureRmApiManagementApi cmdlet creates an Azure API Management API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the ID of the API to create. If you do not specify this parameter, this cmdlet generates an ID for you.
Specifies the name of the web API. This is the public name of the API as it appears on the developer and admin portals.
Specifies a description for the web API.
Specifies the URL of the web service that exposes the API. This URL is used only by Azure API Management, and is not made public. The URL must be one to 2000 characters long.

Specifies the web API path, which is the last part of the API's public URL. This URL is used by API consumers to send requests to the web service, and must be one to 400 characters long. The default value is $Null.
Specifies an array of web API protocols. Valid values are http, https. These are the web protocols over which the API is made available. The default value is $Null.
Specifies the OAuth authorization server ID. The default value is $Null. You must specify this parameter if AuthorizationScope is specified.
Specifies the OAuth operations scope. The default value is $Null.
Specifies the subscription key header name. The default value is $Null.
Specifies the subscription key query string parameter name. The default value is $Null.
Specifies an array of product IDs to which to add the new API.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the ID of the API to create. If you do not specify this parameter, this cmdlet generates an ID for you.
Specifies the name of the web API. This is the public name of the API as it appears on the developer and admin portals.
Specifies a description for the web API.
Specifies the URL of the web service that exposes the API. This URL is used only by Azure API Management, and is not made public. The URL must be one to 2000 characters long.

Specifies the web API path, which is the last part of the API's public URL. This URL is used by API consumers to send requests to the web service, and must be one to 400 characters long. The default value is $Null.
Specifies an array of web API protocols. Valid values are http, https. These are the web protocols over which the API is made available. The default value is $Null.
Specifies the OAuth authorization server ID. The default value is $Null. You must specify this parameter if AuthorizationScope is specified.
Specifies the OAuth operations scope. The default value is $Null.
Specifies the subscription key header name. The default value is $Null.
Specifies the subscription key query string parameter name. The default value is $Null.
Specifies an array of product IDs to which to add the new API.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates an API named EchoApi with the specified URL.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an authorization server.
The New-AzureRmApiManagementAuthorizationServer cmdlet creates an Azure API Management authorization server.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the ID of the authorization server to create.
Specifies the name of the authorization server to create.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an API Management Logger.

`Endpoint=endpoint and key from Azure classic portal`
The Key with Send Rights in the connection string must be configured.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Create an API management operation with request and response details
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$RID = New-Object -TypeName Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.ServiceManagement.Models.PsApiManagementParameter $RID.Name = "RID" $RID.Description = "Resource identifier" $RID.Type = "string" $Query = New-Object -TypeName Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.ServiceManagement.Models.PsApiManagementParameter $Query.Name = "query" $Query.Description = "Query string" $Query.Type = 'string' $Request = New-Object -TypeName Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.ServiceManagement.Models.PsApiManagementRequest $Request.Description = "Create/update resource request" $DummyQp = New-Object -TypeName Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.ServiceManagement.Models.PsApiManagementParameter $DummyQp.Name = 'dummy' $DummyQp.Type = 'string' $DummyQp.Required = $FALSE $Request.QueryParameters = @($DummyQp) $Header = New-Object -TypeName Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.ServiceManagement.Models.PsApiManagementParameter $Header.Name = 'x-custom-header' $Header.Type = 'string' $Request.Headers = @($Header) $RequestRepresentation = New-Object -TypeName Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.ServiceManagement.Models.PsApiManagementRepresentation $RequestRepresentation.ContentType = 'application/json' $RequestRepresentation.Sample = '{ "propName": "propValue" }' $Request.Representations = @($requestRepresentation) $Response = New-Object -TypeName Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.ServiceManagement.Models.PsApiManagementResponse $Response.StatusCode = 204 New-AzureRmApiManagementOperation -Context $APImContext -ApiId $APIId -OperationId "01234567890" -Name 'Create/update resource' -Method 'PUT' -UrlTemplate '/resource/{rid}?q={query}' -Description "Use this operation to create new or update existing resource" -TemplateParameters @($rid, $query) -Request $Request -Responses @($response)

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates an API management operation with request and response details.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies an API.
The Set-AzureRmApiManagementApi cmdlet modifies an Azure API Management API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the ID of the API to modify.
Specifies the name of the web API.
Specifies a description for the web API.
Specifies the URL of the web service that exposes the API. This URL is used only by Azure API Management, and is not made public. The URL must be one to 2000 characters long.

Specifies the web API path, which is the last part of the API's public URL. This URL is used by API consumers to send requests to the web service, and must be one to 400 characters long. The default value is $Null.
Specifies an array of web API protocols. The acceptable values for this parameter are: http and https. These are the web protocols over which the API is made available. The default value is $Null.
Specifies the OAuth authorization server identifier. The default value is $Null. You must specify this parameter if AuthorizationScope is specified.
Specifies the OAuth operations scope. The default value is $Null.
Specifies the name of the subscription key header. The default value is $Null.
Specifies the name of the subscription key query string parameter. The default value is $Null.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the ID of the API to modify.
Specifies the name of the web API.
Specifies a description for the web API.
Specifies the URL of the web service that exposes the API. This URL is used only by Azure API Management, and is not made public. The URL must be one to 2000 characters long.

Specifies the web API path, which is the last part of the API's public URL. This URL is used by API consumers to send requests to the web service, and must be one to 400 characters long. The default value is $Null.
Specifies an array of web API protocols. The acceptable values for this parameter are: http and https. These are the web protocols over which the API is made available. The default value is $Null.
Specifies the OAuth authorization server identifier. The default value is $Null. You must specify this parameter if AuthorizationScope is specified.
Specifies the OAuth operations scope. The default value is $Null.
Specifies the name of the subscription key header. The default value is $Null.
Specifies the name of the subscription key query string parameter. The default value is $Null.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1 Modify an API
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Set-AzureRmApiManagementApi -Context $ApiMgmtContext -Name "EchoApi" -ServiceUrl "https://contoso.com/apis/echo" -Protocols @('https') -Description "Responds with what was sent" -Path "echo"

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies an API Management Logger.
The Set-AzureRmApiManagementLogger cmdlet modifies settings of an Azure API Management Logger .

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the ID of the logger to update.
Specifies the entity name of an event hub from Azure classic portal.
Specifies an Azure Event Hubs connection string that includes Send policy rights.
Specifies that the records in the logger are buffered before publishing. When records are buffered, they are sent to Event Hubs every 15 seconds, or whenever the buffer receives 256 KB of messages.
Indicates that this cmdlet returns the PsApiManagementLogger that this cmdlet modifies.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
Specifies the ID of the logger to update.
Specifies the entity name of an event hub from Azure classic portal.
Specifies an Azure Event Hubs connection string that includes Send policy rights.
Specifies that the records in the logger are buffered before publishing. When records are buffered, they are sent to Event Hubs every 15 seconds, or whenever the buffer receives 256 KB of messages.
Indicates that this cmdlet returns the PsApiManagementLogger that this cmdlet modifies.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Modify a logger
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Set-AzureRmApiManagementLogger -Context $ApimContext -LoggerId "Logger123" -Name "ContosoSdkEventHub" -ConnectionString "Endpoint=sb://ContosoSdkEventHubs.servicebus.windows.net/;SharedAccessKeyName=SendKey;SharedAccessKey=<key>" -Description "updated SDK event hub logger" -PassThru

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies an API Management Property.
The Set-AzureRmApiManagementProperty cmdlet modifies an Azure API Management Property.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies an ID of the property that this cmdlet modifies.
Specifies the name of the property. Maximum length is 100 characters. Names contain only letters, digits, period, dash, and underscore characters.
Specifies a value for the property. This value can contain policy expressions. Maximum length is 1000 characters. The value may not be empty or consist only of whitespace.
Indicates that the property value is a secret and should be encrypted.
Specifies an array of tags that this cmdlet associates to the property. You can use tags to filter the property list.
Indicates that this cmdlet returns the PsApiManagementProperty that this cmdlet modifies.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
